section.title: Network Requirements
section.para: From a network perspective, DNS and DNSSEC packets are very similar, DNSSEC responses just look bigger.

There are three things to test your network for, to make sure it is ready for DNSSEC:
Verify connectivity over both UDP and TCP port 53 (See )
Firewall or packet inspection devices need to be modern or smart enough to accept DNS packets larger than 512 bytes (See )
Make sure your network gear does not throw away larger DNS fragmented packets when it exceeds MTU.
Because of the increased packet size, DNSSEC may fall back to TCP more often then traditional (insecure) DNS.
